poem:
Play On

Imagine Duke Orsino  
in a zoot suit,  
lost in the swing of unrequited  
love, trumpets kissing the air  
with Ellington's sincerity.  
Violas turn saxophones,  
as notes shimmy through disguise,  
transforming Shakespeare's longing  
into a bebop of hearts—  
each beat a step closer  
to the dance of discovery.
